Posts.Content: May 31, 2007 04:03PM cindbo wrote: Hey rad ladies. I am on 12/33, it was way scarier for me in the beginning than chemo or surgery. I think it is the fact that we are in there with the machines, even though they monitor us it is a bit more solo. i find now that there is a routine I am much more relaxed, just now starting to get some redness, they gave me a script for a cream called xclair. What potions have you found handy?
Posts.Title: June 07 Rads leebrigs Lynn12

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2007 06:51AM cindbo wrote: Hi Lynn, Just crusing through, new to this post. I finished on July 2nd, also a mastectomy 33rads last 5 were boosts. They gave me a cream called Xclair, it was very soothing. I also had to take pain meds, it took about a week after they quit rediating that area and then I started to notice my skin to calm down. It is very painful and I went into chemo mode, minimized what I did around the house, got help whereever I could, just for those couple of days. I hope this note finds you celebrating the end of rads!
Posts.Title: June 07 Rads leebrigs Lynn12
